docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: There is growing medical concern that the very young children of cocaine-addicted parents can be injured by breathing the drug-laced air in their homes.

headline.main: Drug-Laced Air Called Risk to Babies

docs.snippet: LEAD: There is growing medical concern that the very young children of cocaine-addicted parents can be injured by breathing the drug-laced air in their homes.

byline.original: By MICHAEL deCOURCY HINDS, Special to The New York Times
